derivation: a primitive root; properly, to swell out or up; used only as denominative from H6119 (עָקֵב),
strongs_def: to seize by the heel; figuratively, to circumvent (as if tripping up the heels); also to restrain (as if holding by the heel)
kjv_def: take by the heel, stay, supplant, [idiom] utterly.
